media.description: Short 3D Nyanko-sensei animations bundled on DVD/BD's of the Zoku Natsume Yuujinchou series.
A short animation by Taku Furukawa.
A 15 second long commercial produced for the Yomiuri Shimbun newspaper.

title.userPreferred: Issho ni Training: Training with Hinako

media.description:
"First muscle training animation ever," a 16-year-old girl named Hinako leads exercises in push-ups, sit-ups, and squats. Hinako was once a human, but she was turned into an anime character when she was a second-year middle-school student.

(Source: Anime News Network)
First special is a music video for the opening song. Second special is a bonus episode.
Music video sung by 鎮座DOPENESS for his "100% Rap" album. Song composition is done by EVISBEATS.
A music video for Rag Fair's song "Magical Music Train."
A music video for SiMoN's song "nagisa".

In a bleak and distant future, the last hope of tomorrow’s dreamers is a place they call the Asylum. When her father forbids her from becoming an artist, Hiyoko runs off to a tent city set up in an abandoned stadium called The Asylum. She meets other gifted youth there, and she finds herself and her purpose. But when profiteering officials and police plot to tear the Asylum down, they use art and culture to win the hearts of the people in a festival they call the Asylum Session.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
A short animation by Taku Furukawa.
A short animation film by Taku Furukawa.
A short animation by Taku Furukawa.
A music video for Hajime Nikiyoshi's song "Ame no Bus Stop Hen"
A music video for the Oshare Boys song "anygedybudybombom."
Short Movie by Keiichi Tanaami

Computer-animated gag shorts about two female agents. Produced by Production I.G and distributed online by Animenewsnetwork.

But wait! What are they really? They are, in fact, secret agents on a mission to discipline the wicked men of the world.

KOKO is a sure-shot markswoman, who's number one with a bullet. MIKA can defeat any evil-doer with her bear-fisted martial arts moves. Today, as usual, the girls are on the set of a TV drama. KOKO is shooting a bathtub scene...MIKA is shooting a bedroom scene...

But their secret, anonymous boss always somehow finds the "perfect " time to call them for another mission!

When duty calls, what's a girl to do?

The pair sets off into action, with an unsuspecting film crew left behind!
That's when they transform into the ABUNAI SISTERS, changing to sexy outfits and ready to go!!

These dynamic debutantes are determined to punish diabolical men with often funny personality and sexy action!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
A surreal short created by Mirai Mizue.
Music video by Yoriko Mizushiri for the song Umi by Japanese band Kuchiroro that was featured on their sixth album "everyday is a symphony."
Picture dramas included on the DVDs.

title.userPreferred: Hapi Fa Zi: Yi Shui Jingang

media.description:
Happy Things 3 is an animated sitcom depicting the family life of twin siblings in the hutongs of old Beijing, China, with strong characters and a light-hearted, down-to-earth sitcom style. It highlights the unique Chinese concepts of family, friendship and love while laughing out loud at the true meaning of life.

(Source: QQ, translated)

It's every high school baseball team's dream to go to the legendary Koshien Stadium Tournament. For the first time in years, Seido High School has a chance—star player Gorilla Matsui has finally given the team an opportunity to succeed. Most delighted at this prospect is Principal Kocho. However, the Head teacher reveals to him that the first game will be played against the Gedo High School, infamous for brutally killing all their opponents. Kocho instantly loses all hope, both for his students' lives and of winning the tournament.

An event that happens to a man based on growth, psychology, egoism, and shamanism.

Short animation by Ryoji Yamada at Tama Art University
The 7th DVD of Sugar Bunnies Chocolate! contained the unaired episode 27 finale.
Yoshiki Imazu's graduation work at Musashino Art University.

title.userPreferred: Art of Yoh Yoshinari: Rough Sketches - Tezuka Characters

media.description: Tribute animation by Yoh Yoshinari featuring Tezuka characters.

title.userPreferred: Boku to Gaku: Ano Natsu no Monogatari

media.description: An educational film about losing hope in children in Japan. In the movie's example, how it is bad it is to say another child "doesn't stand a chance" or "don't think too much of them, they won't amount to anything" because of their upbringing or background or single action they did.
Music video for the song Nijiiro Love Letter by Mio Isayama that was featured on NHK's Minna no Uta program. The video was animated by Toshio Nishiuchi.

A metaphorical poetry song about the real-life wish of a 15-year-old girl with a terminal illness. She was supposed to have died at the age of 10 but kept fighting to stay alive. The band Indigo Blue who made this song in her honor never had a chance to meet her directly while she was alive but wanted to send her mighty message across Japan that you can be happy if you keep smiling forever.
A girl catches a mysterious cat creature in her bucket. Soon a monster attacks her and the creature envelops her like a power suit in order to fight.

After being accused of stealing military secrets, Dr. Demian escapes from custody and expose corruption within the military; but he's pursued by a strike force that operates an experimental robot that he developed.

(Source: eigoMANGA)

title.userPreferred: Tales of the Abyss: Skit-fuu Jikan Yokoku "Score"

media.description: Specials included in the DVD release of Tales of the Abyss.

An elf of dandelion takes off her bloom after her boyfriend, who has transformed into down a bit earlier. But there are monsters outside, and they take aim at her. In the outer world with no one to depend on, she grows up bravely.  (Source:  Youtube)
A Short Animation set in an alternative world about a rat who is in love with cheese.
Short film by Takashi Ohashi, creatively depicting a musical score as it plays out.
Short animation directed by Takashi Ohashi, featuring the song Flying Messenger by Yumi Matsutoya.
Graduation film by Takashi Ohashi, featuring a 360° time lapse of Daiba,Tokyo set to classical music, animating the background lights of the city.
